concise_definition: v. 失去, 丢失, 输掉, 丧失

definitions.explanation_en: To no longer have something that was previously possessed, either through misplacement, theft, or failure to retain it.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指不再拥有之前拥有的东西，可能是由于遗失、被盗或未能保持。
definitions.example_en: I lost my keys on the way to work this morning.
definitions.example_cn: 今天早上我去上班的路上把钥匙弄丢了。

definitions.explanation_en: To be defeated in a competition, game, or contest; to fail to win.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指在比赛、游戏或竞争中被击败；未能获胜。
definitions.example_en: Our team lost the championship match by just one point.
definitions.example_cn: 我们的队伍以一分之差输掉了冠军赛。

definitions.explanation_en: To fail to keep or maintain something abstract, such as time, an opportunity, or a quality (e.g., hope, weight, consciousness).
definitions.explanation_cn: 指未能保持某种抽象事物，如时间、机会或品质（例如希望、体重、意识）。
definitions.example_en: She lost her sense of direction in the unfamiliar city.
definitions.example_cn: 她在陌生的城市里迷失了方向感。

definitions.explanation_en: To cause someone to no longer have a relationship or connection, especially through death, separation, or abandonment.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指因死亡、分离或抛弃而导致某人不再拥有某种关系或联系。
definitions.example_en: He lost his father when he was only five years old.
definitions.example_cn: 他五岁时就失去了父亲。

comparison.analysis: “Misplace” (放错地方) 专指因疏忽而将物品放在错误的地方，通常暗示物品仍在某处，只是暂时找不到。而 “lose” 的范围更广，可能包括永久性丢失、被盗或无法找回的情况。
“Defeat” (击败) 是一个更正式、更强调结果的词，常用于军事、体育或政治语境，指明确战胜对手。而 “lose” 是从失败方的角度出发，侧重于自身状态的改变，语气更主观、更个人化。
“Waste” (浪费) 指因不当使用或忽视而使资源、时间或机会失去其价值，强调主观上的不珍惜。而 “lose” 更中性，仅表示失去，不必然包含主观过错。例如：你可能无意中 lose 一个机会，但你是在 waste 一个机会。
